column4: ok guys i have done more painstaking h4xoring on this linux box and have come to the following http://www.linux.org.mt/node/82
I didn't see any of your earlier messages, but have you tried looking at http://www.thinkwiki.org?  They have alot of thinkpad resources, and helped me get my T60 working 100%

fglrxinfo lists my chip as Mesa DRI Radeon 20060327 AGP 1x NO-TCL
What does the Driver section under "Device" in xorg.conf say?
: driver is "ati"
If you installed the fglrx driver you'll need to change it to "fglrx".
: i have done that several times, but when i do it busts my gui
Did you follow the instructions on the BinaryDriverHowTo page regarding fixing the Mesa issue?
:yes i have not all of them tho as some i dont know how to do
Which steps are you having difficulty with?
: the step "make sure that the restricted-modules package installed correspond to the kernel you are running and that you can load the fglrx driver.... etc.....
pici : i cant load the fglrx driver, nor can i unload the radeon and dri modules
it says they in use
Basically, you just need to make sure that you have the linux-restricted-modules-`uname -r` installed.
!flash64 > wdwhitney (see the private message from ubotu)
: that makes little sense to me
: could you please /j #ubuntu-mesaprob
to avoid all the chatter
Sorry.  You need the linux-restricted-modules-yourkernelversion installed. i.e. do 'sudo apt-get install linux-restricted-modules-`uname -r`'
